beginnings.title: Beginnings
beginnings.description: Find out how I started out in the world of development.
beginnings.paragraph1: Before I started in this world of web development, I used to make videos on youtube about video games, in those moments I learned to edit videos, to achieve it, I used tools like <highlight>Adobe After Effects, Sony Vegas Pro, Camtasia, and so on.</highlight> To make the thumbnail of my videos I learned to use <highlight>Adobe Photoshop</highlight>.
beginnings.paragraph2: You are probably wondering, how I switched from the YouTube world to development, well, <highlight>I am a non-conformist person, I always want to learn or make new things,</highlight> that's why I wished to make my own website to my channel to publish my own content, have control of it and better yet, add my YouTube videos automatically.
beginnings.paragraph3: Although that was my initial idea, I didn't know how to start doing it, so I began to look for videos on YouTube of "how to create your own website" and, finally I found a website that created other websites called <link>Wix</link>. I was very excited because I was creating something of my own with my own hands, It was basically like<highlight>"my own little personal brand".</highlight> As time went on, I felt the need to add more and more things, to the point where Wix wouldn't let me do what I wanted to do and I couldn't find videos to help me with that either.
beginnings.paragraph4: So, I kept searching on the Internet how to do what I wanted, I realized that it was possible to do it but with code and, unfortunately, Wix didn't give me the freedom to use code on its site. However, <highlight>I never gave up</highlight> and started looking for a solution, this solution was to make the page again with HTML and CSS. Once I got the same visual result as my Wix page, I tried to use the code I previously found by following what people were saying on the internet.
beginnings.paragraph5: From there, I became curious about creating web pages, and little by little I acquired enough knowledge to find <highlight>my first job in my native country, Venezuela.</highlight>

learning.title: Learning
learning.description: What have I learned in the last few years?
learning.paragraph1: Continuing with the story line, in my first job I had the opportunity to learn <linkAngularJs>AngularJS</linkAngularJs> and <linkAngular2>Angular 2</linkAngular2>, with both technologies I participated in the development of a telecommunications app where I worked with real-time data. Also, I participated in a <highlight>E-learning</highlight> project.
learning.paragraph2: After 1 year I had to leave my country to go to Argentina where I had the chance to work with Angular 5 in a <highlight>call center</highlight> project. After two years, I changed the project for another one related to customer service through chat that was developed with <linkReact>React</linkReact> in the Frontend. In that occasion one of the things I learned was the <linkMicroFrontend>micro frontends</linkMicroFrontend> concept, thanks to that architecture we could <highlight>embed the chat inside another monolithic application built in AngularJS.</highlight> We were also able to do this within the mobile applications with native code, this time using <linkWebView>Web Views.</linkWebView>
learning.paragraph3: What I liked the most about this was <highlight>how to make several applications live together in a single application</highlight>, regardless of the technologies in which they were made, be in a team completely separated to the monolithic team and achieve independence with the development and deployment of new features.
learning.paragraph4: Simultaneously to my work, I am working on my own blog which is built with <linkSvelte>Svelte</linkSvelte> (you probably saw it in my <linkProjects>featured projects</linkProjects>) and although at the time of writing this, the backend is not connected to it, I am using <linkNestJs>NestJS</linkNestJs> to make the sessions so that people can create their own content directly on my blog.
learning.paragraph5: I have also been working as a freelancer at <linkWorkana>Workana</linkWorkana> for quite a long time, since I started, I have always been in the mobile area, this time using <linkIonic>Ionic 3</linkIonic> and <linkReactNative>React Native</linkReactNative> to develop the applications.
learning.paragraph6: Lastly, nowadays I am working with <linkVueJs>VueJS</linkVueJs> in a e-commerce project.
